title: Jobless Claims Edge Lower in Tight U.S. Labor Market
sub_head: Worker filings for unemployment benefits have trended lower since start of the year
body:
New applications for unemployment benefits edged lower last week, remaining near historically low levels in a robust U.S. labor market.
Initial jobless claims, a proxy for layoffs, fell by 15,000 to a seasonally adjusted 214,000 for the week ended March 12, the Labor Department said Thursday. The four-week moving average, which smooths out week-to-week volatility, decreased to 223,000, compared with the previous weekâ€™s revised 231,750.
